p: To date, although some repurposed drugs showed inhibitory effect on SARS-CoV-2, no drugs have been licensed to be used in the treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection or other coronavirus infections in humans, and no vaccines have been licensed to prevent these infections. Just days after Chinese scientists shared the genetic map of SARS-CoV-2, scientists around the world, along with a list of biotech and vaccine companies, promptly launched a race to pursue different types of vaccines to prevent infection with this novel virus. Up to the end of April 2020, at least 115 SARS-CoV-2 vaccine projects have been announced to be in development, including vectored vaccines, oral vaccines, subunit vaccines, inactivated vaccines, peptide-based vaccines, nucleotide-based vaccine, etc. Several SARS-CoV-2 vaccine candidates have recently been approved for clinical phase I or II development (Thanh Le et al. 2020).
